import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 
import seaborn as sns
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

%matplotlib inline
source.cf176ceb:
int_data = ['math score' , 'reading score' , 'writing score']
cat_data = list(set(data.columns) - set(int_data))
source.0d6b401c:
def my_plot2():
    for i in cat_data:
        fig , (ax1 , ax2 , ax3) = plt.subplots(1, 3,figsize=(16,5))
        sns.boxplot(data = data , x = i , y = 'math score' , ax = ax1)
        ax1.set_xticklabels(labels = data[i].unique() , rotation = 90)
        sns.boxplot(data = data , x = i , y = 'reading score' , ax = ax2)
        ax2.set_xticklabels(labels = data[i].unique() , rotation = 90)
        sns.boxplot(data = data , x = i , y = 'writing score' , ax = ax3)
        ax3.set_xticklabels(labels = data[i].unique() , rotation = 90)
        yield
plot2 = my_plot2()
next(plot2)

plt.figure(figsize = [14,8])
sns.stripplot(data = data , x = 'gender',y = 'math score',
             hue = 'test preparation course',jitter = 0.35 , dodge = True)
plt.title("See the diff between math score fo each gender by test preparation");
source.419359d5:

sns.violinplot(data = data , x = 'gender',y = 'math score',
             hue = 'parental level of education')
plt.title("See the diff between math score fo each gender by education level");
source.85c15b69:
## see which gender has the max mean in three scores
d1 = data.groupby('gender')['math score','reading score' ,'writing score'].mean()
d1['avg_score'] = (d1['math score'] + d1['reading score'] + d1['writing score'])/3
d1[['avg_score']].reset_index()[['gender','avg_score']].plot(kind = 'bar')

sns.countplot(data = data , x = 'gender' , hue = 'parental level of education')
